member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Controls.ColumnsPickerControl
member.summary: ColumnsPickerControl is a UserControl for selecting and ordering a collection of Currituck fields/columns and also existing user-defined fields. It has two listviews with available and selected columns and buttons to move items between them.

member.name: E:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Controls.IWorkItemControl.AfterUpdateDatasource
member.summary: This event is signaled by control implementations preceeded by BeforeUpdateDatasource to avoid invalidation notifications stemming from changes performed by the control itself.

member.name: E:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Controls.IWorkItemControl.BeforeUpdateDatasource
member.summary: This event is signaled by control implementations when updating Data Source followed by a signal to AfterUpdateDatasource to avoid invalidation notifications stemming from changes performed by the control itself.

member.summary: Invalidates the data source used by this control, which causes the control to reset its state based on the current field binding.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Controls.PickWorkItemsControl
member.summary: PickWorkItemsControl is a UserControl for selecting Currituck workitems from a List that can be populated from a query retrieved from the portfolio server or from a simple picker query built from workitem Type, ID and Title words. The List can be single or multiple selection.

member.summary: indicates whether to filter out work items that are not part of the selected project. If this property is set to 'true' and a query returns work items that are not members of the currently selected project then a dialog box is displayed and the work items are not shown.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Controls.StoryboardLinkingHandler
member.summary: Provides a double-click handler for storyboard links stored in TFS and linked to a work item. From the comment on IClientLinking: "It should be explicitly declared as ComVisible to better work with the plugin architecture without dependency on COM visibility set for the assembly

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Controls.StoryboardLinkingHandler.ExecuteDefaultAction(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Opens the Uri associated with the specified storyboard Artifact Uri if it is possible in response to a request from the WIT client linking UI.
member.returns: A boolean value indicating whether the Uri associated with the specified artifact Uri was opened successfully.
member.param: The TFS artifact Uri returned from the work item store.
Context for the specified artifact.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Controls.VirtualColumn
member.summary: Virtual Column (Field) class to passed to/from ColumnsPickerControl class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Controls.VirtualColumn.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Used by the ColumnsPickerControl exclusively to set the requiredText

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Controls.VirtualColumn.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: No default constructor; non-empty Display string is always required.Display is the string shown in ColumnsPickerControl list box and probably displayed to user by caller. MappedDatabaseField is the Currituck field name that this column is mapped to. It may be the same as Display. It will be empty or null for non-mapped columns. Required means caller requires this field and ColumnsPickerControl cannot delete it. Example might be the ID field.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Controls.VirtualColumn.GetFakedColumnReferenceNamePrefix
member.summary: This method is here so that other classes can retrieve mapped reference for faked columns Deserialization needs this name to re-construct the list after the workbook is loaded.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Controls.VirtualColumn.GetNextFakedColumnReferenceName
member.summary: We have to treat the faked columns to be the same as round trip columns However, faked columns do not have database fields to map against so we must have a reference name (which is mapped to a database field) This format of the faked reference name is System.Faked

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Controls.VirtualColumn.IsFakedReferenceName(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Check the reference name is one of the "faked" name

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Controls.VirtualColumn.ToString
member.summary: Return DetailedDisplay if it is required (used exclusively in ColumnsPickerControl), otherwise return Display.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Controls.VirtualColumnCollection
member.summary: Virtual Column (Field) List class to passed to/from ColumnsPickerControl class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Controls.WorkItemResultGrid
member.summary: This class provides a simple interface to display work items. Given a IResultListDataProvider and a ResultOptions object (or a WorkItemStore and a WIQL statement) the grid will display the contents of the WorkItemCollection or result tree for link queries. The user may add their own columns by use of Columns.Add and by implementing the event CellValueNeeded

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the WorkItemResultGrid using TFS themed color styling.

member.returns: the index of the first item that has a match to this id, -1 if not found
member.param: work item id

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.WpfControls.WorkItemControl.ReadOnly
member.summary: ReadOnly - Returns whether the view is currently readonly. Setting this property does render the view. You must call RenderView() for the change in ReadOnly to take effect.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.WpfControls.WorkItemControl.RenderView
member.summary: RenderView - Render the view.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.WpfControls.WorkItemControl.RenderView(System.Boolean)
member.summary: RenderView - Render the view.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.WpfControls.WorkItemControl.ShowAllFieldErrors(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set focus to the first field that has an error and show the error message
